n.收入,收益,所得Low-income families need government's help.低收入家庭需要政府帮助.



noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■money that is earned from doing work or received from investments 收入；收益
•Average incomes have risen by 4.5% over the past year.人均收入比去年上升了4.5%。

•More help is needed for people on low incomes.低收入人士需要更多的帮助。

•I haven't had much income from my stocks and shares this year.今年我在股票上没有多少收益。





income, revenue

这组词都有“收入”的意思，其区别是：
income: 主要指个人收入，包括劳动所得和利润。
revenue: 专指国家或企业的收入，主要指国家的税收。



fee, earnings, wage, allowance, income, pay, salary

这组词都有“工资、收入”的意思，其区别是：
fee: 指提供某种服务收取的固定费用。
earnings: 多指通过劳动或投资等手段所得到的收入。
wage: 多用复数形式，指按小时、日或星期的报酬，通常指体力劳动者的工资。
allowance: 指收入中的补贴部分。
income: 与earnings含义很相近，但前者强调总收入。
pay: 是个通用词，可取代salary与wage.
salary: 指按年定下，按月或星期平均给予的报酬，指脑力劳动者的薪水。


n. 收入， [会计] 收益； [经] 所得
 - revenue, proceeds, earning, yield, receipt
examples: 英 ['ɪnkʌm] 美 ['ɪnkʌm]
n.收入；所得；收益

(1) His income is well below the average.(2) My monthly income was just over 200 pounds.(3) He needs a high income to support such a large family.(4) The money I got was a useful supplement to my ordinary income.(5) The senate was censured for income tax evasion.(6) The Inland Revenue is responsible for collecting income tax.(7) The shopkeeper feels happy at the increasing income.
(1) 他的收入大大低于平均水平。(2) 我每月的收入是200多磅。(3) 他需要有高收入才能供养得起这样一个大家庭。(4) 我得到的那笔钱是很管用的外快。(5) 这名参议员因逃避缴纳所得税而受到指责。(6) 税务局负责征收所得税。(7) 对于日益增多的收益,店老板乐开了花。

translation:
adj. 错误的; 不正确的; 不能接受的; （说话或举止）不合规矩的

分布：不正确的(59%)，错误的(41%)


→in-,不，非，correct,正确的。



US [-kə'rekt] adjective ■not correct or not true 不正确的；不真实的
•an incorrect answer/diagnosis错误的答案／诊断

•The assumptions made about the economy's rate of growth proved to be incorrect.对经济增长率的推测证明是不正确的。
■not acceptable or not as it should be 不可接受的；不适当的
•It's incorrect to address people by their first names at these formal events.在这些正式的场合，直呼别人姓名是不恰当的。

•incorrect grammar不正确的文法




adj. 错误的，不正确的；不适当的；不真实的
 - false, impossible, wrong, improper, unhappy
examples: 英 [ˌɪnkə'rekt] 美 [ˌɪnkə'rekt]
adj.不正确的；错误的
(1) Which of the following collocations is incorrect?(2) The statement was proven incorrect.(3) Your pronunciation is incorrect.(4) It turned out that our calculations were incorrect.
(1) 下列选项中哪一种搭配是不正确的？(2) 这种说法证明是不正确的。(3) 你的发音是错误的。(4) 结果证明我们的计算是错误的。
[sound:youdao-88510e75-e9be11d7-7a97d10e-568f2c39-bc061b43.mp3]

translation:
adv. 越来越多地; 日益，格外; 越来越…; 愈

分布：越来越多地(67%)，逐渐地(33%)


ad.不断增加地,日益After a decrease, the price of the grease increases increasingly.下跌过一次之后,润滑脂的价格日益上涨.



adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■more and more 越来越多地，不断增加地
•to be increasingly important/common越来越重要／普遍

•Increasingly, there is pressure on the council to reverse its decision.要求市政会推翻其决定的压力越来越大。




adv. 越来越多地；渐增地
 - pyramidally, cumulatively
examples: 英 [ɪn'kriːsɪŋli] 美 [ɪn'kriːsɪŋli]
adv.逐渐地；越来越多地

(1) Increasingly, farm land is yielding to property development.(2) New Zealand is an increasingly multicultural society.(3) He grew increasingly to rely on her.(4) Common preconceptions about life in this district are increasingly being challenged.
(1) 地产的发展逐渐占据了农田。(2) 新西兰已经逐渐成为多元文化交融的国家。(3) 他越来越依赖她了。(4) 原先普遍存在著对那一地区生活的成见越来越站不住脚了。
[sound:youdao-5cb56d31-fce785c2-2a69ee09-c70220ef-d87dfb65.mp3]

translation:
adv. 的确，确实，实在; 实际上，真正地; 真的，真是; 甚至

分布：真正地(55%)，甚至(30%)，事实上(15%)


→来自in deed,事实上，后连写作为副词使用。比较very,even.
ad.确实,实在;真正地,多么We need reed needles to speed the deed indeed.我们确实需要一些芦苇针来加快行动.



adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■really or certainly, often used to emphasize something 的确，实在
•Indeed, it could be the worst environmental disaster in Western Europe this century.这确实可能是本世纪西欧最严重的环境灾难。

•Evidence suggests that errors may indeed be occurring.证据显示可能确实出错了。

•We live in strange times indeed.我们确实生活在不可思议的时代。

•mainly UK Many people are very poor indeed.许多人确实很穷。
■used to express that something is correct 确实，当然
•"Is this your dog?" "It is indeed."/"Indeed it is."“这是你的狗吗？”“当然是。”

•Yes, I did indeed say that.是的，我确实那样说过。
■used to add some extra information which develops or supports something you have just said 甚至，而且
•For such creatures, speed is not important - indeed it is counterproductive.对这些生物而言，速度并不重要，速度太高甚至会适得其反。

•I am happy, indeed proud, to be associated with this project.能参与这个专案计划我很高兴，甚至感到骄傲。

[ɪn'di:d] exclamation ■used to express surprise, anger, or lack of belief or interest （表示惊讶、恼怒、不相信、不感兴趣）
•"She said she won't come back until Monday." "Won't she, indeed?"“她说她星期一以前不会回来。”“哦，是吗？”

•"When will we get a pay rise?" "When indeed?"“我们甚么时候能获加薪？”“是呀，甚么时候加呢？”





truly, indeed, really, actually

这组词都有“确实地，真正地”的意思，其区别是：
truly: 强调客观存在的真实性，没有任何虚假。
indeed: 一般用于肯定或证实对方所说的话，多承接前言，也用来加强或肯定自己说话的语气。
really: 主要用于强调与事实或现实不相违背，也可表示不快、惊奇或某种含蓄的怀疑。
actually: 侧重于实际的事，而不是凭空想象或推测的事。


adv. 的确；实在；真正地；甚至
 - just, sure, even
examples: 英 [ɪn'diːd] 美 [ɪn'diːd]
adv.真正地；的确，确实；事实上；甚至

(1) I was very glad indeed to hear the news.(2) Indeed he has a solemn face, but he is very humorous at heart.(3) I don't mind. Indeed, I am delighted to help.(4) Indeed he was a patron of culture religion.
(1) 我听到这消息的确非常高兴。(2) 他的确有一副严肃的脸孔，但内心却是很富幽默感。(3) 我不在乎。其实,我很乐意帮忙。(4) 事实上他是文化和宗教的庇护者。
[sound:youdao-eadf7b3c-07776c2c-df380cfc-459481a9-0e340bc9.mp3]

translation:
adj. 无限期的，无限期的; 不明确的，模糊的; 模糊的; [语]不定的

→in-,不，非，definite,明确的。

•an indefinite number of people不确定的人数





faint, dim, indefinite, vague, obscure, ambiguous

这组词都有“不明确的，模糊的”的意思，其区别是：
faint: 指对某事物印象不深，或指声音微弱或希望的渺茫等。
dim: 侧重指或因光线暗淡，或因年代久远、身体欠佳等因素而产生视觉或察觉方面的困难。
indefinite: 指无明确定义或限定，重点或总体轮廓不明确。
vague: 多指因语言不确切，太笼统或因构思含糊、不完善而造成模糊难解。
obscure: 语气最强，指晦涩难懂。
ambiguous: 指文章或讲话中，意思可能有多种理解，令人捉摸不定。


adj. 不确定的；无限的；模糊的
 - fuzzy, huge, dark, infinite, unsure

n.独立,自主This country gained its independence in 1949.这个国家在1949年获得独立.



noun uncountable  IMPROVER  ■freedom from being governed or ruled by another country （国家的）独立

translation:
adj. 自主的; 不相关连的; 无党派的; 不相干的人所做的（或提供的）

→in-,不，非，dependence,依靠。即不依靠的，独立的。
独立的(in不+dependent依靠的)[pend,pens=hang,表示"悬挂"]
a.(of)独立的,自主的The dependent dependant can't live independently.依靠别人的被赡养者不能独立生活.



adjective NOT INFLUENCED  不受影响的   ESSENTIAL  ■not influenced or controlled in any way by other people, events or things 独立的
•an independent enquiry / organization独立调查／机构

•They all made the same comment, quite independent of each other (= without deciding together to do so).他们都不约而同作出了相同的评论。
■describes a politician who does not agree or vote with any particular political party （从政者）无党派的■specialized ■describes a grammatical clause which forms part of a sentence but can also form a separate sentence （分句）独立的

independent, dependent

dependent: 依赖的，依靠的(on, upon)。如：Success is dependent on your hard work.

examples: 英 [ˌɪndɪ'pendənt] 美 [ˌɪndɪ'pendənt]

translation:
n. 索引; <数>指数; 指示; 标志
vt. 给…编索引; 把…编入索引; [经济学]按生活指数调整（工资、价格等）
vi. [机械学]转位

时态：indexed, indexing, indexes
分布：索引(65%)，指数(33%)，指出(1%)，编索引(1%)


→来自拉丁语indicare,指出，说明，来自in-,进入，使，-dic,指出，说，词源同digit,indication.引申词义指数，标志，特征等。其复数形式为indices.
n.索引,指针,指数,指标v.做索引I'm perplexed by the flexible complex index of sex and age.我被灵活复杂的性别与年龄索引迷惑住了.



noun (plural indices or indexes)LIST  列表   ADVANCED  countable ■an alphabetical list, such as one printed at the back of a book showing which page a subject, name, etc. is found on （书后关于主题、姓名等的）索引
•Try looking up 'heart disease' in the index.试试在索引中寻找“心脏病”这个条目。
countable ■a collection of information stored on a computer or on a set of cards, in alphabetical order （电脑或卡片上的）索引
•He has all his friends' names and addresses on a card index.他将所有朋友的姓名及位址都做了卡片索引。

['ɪn.deks] noun (plural indices or indexes)COMPARISON  比较  countable ■a system of numbers used for comparing values of things which change according to each other or a fixed standard 指数
•the FTSE 100 Index伦敦《金融时报》指数

•the Dow Jones Index道‧琼斯指数

•a wage/price index工资／价格指数
countable usually singular ■something which shows how strong or common a condition or feeling is 标志；指标；表征
•Consumer spending is often a good index of public confidence in the economy.消费支出经常是显示公众对经济的信心的有效指标。

['ɪn.deks] verb transitive MAKE LIST  编入索引  ■to prepare an index for a book or collection, or arrange it in an index 为…编索引；把…编入索引
•Our computer indexes several thousand new records every second.我们的电脑每秒钟可把几千个新纪录编入索引。

•The book contains a lot of information, but it's not very well indexed.这本书的资料很丰富，但索引做得不好。

['ɪn.deks] verb transitive COMPARE  比较  ■to change a system of numbers according to each other or a fixed standard 将…与…挂钩；使指数化
•Living expenses will be indexed to/in line with inflation (= to take inflation into consideration).生活费用将与通货膨胀挂钩。




n. 指标；指数； [图情] 索引；指针
 - finger, indicatrix

 - to point out, to indicate
examples: 英 ['ɪndeks] 美 ['ɪndeks]

(1) Do you know the price index in the city?(2) The index is arranged in alphabetical order.(3) The handler for this event receives the column index and row index of the mouse pointer position.(4) The pointer from an index row in a nonclustered index to a data row is called a row locator.(5) Wrinkles index advancing age.(6) The book is not well indexed.(7) All persons and places mentioned are carefully indexed.
(1) 你知道这个城市的物价指数吗？(2) 这索引是按字母顺序排列的。(3) 此事件的处理程序接收鼠标指针所在位置的列索引和行索引。(4) 从非聚集索引中的索引行指向数据行的指针称为行定位器。(5) 皱纹显示出年岁在增加。(6) 这部书索引做得不好。(7) 所有提及的人名和地名都被仔细地编入索引中。

translation:
vt. 表明，标示，指示; 象征，暗示，预示; [医]显示需要做…的治疗

时态：indicated, indicating, indicates
分布：表明(47%)，指示(30%)，显示(15%)，指明(5%)，象征(3%)


→来自拉丁语indicare,指出，说明，来自in-,进入，使，-dic,指出，说，词源同digit,index.引申词义指示，暗示。
指示;表示(in进入+dicate→说进去→指示,指明)[dict,dic=say,assert,表示"说话,断言"]
v.指出,指示;表明,暗示The sloped envelope indicates the development velocity of printing.那个倾斜的信封显示了印刷的发展速度.



verb SHOW  表明   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to show, point or make clear in another way 标示；表明；显示
•Exploratory investigations have indicated large amounts of oil below the sea bed.勘测调查显示海床下有大量的石油。

•[+ question word] Please indicate wh ich free gift you would like to receive.请标出你想要哪种免费礼物。

•[+ (that)] She indicated to me (that) she didn't want me to say anything.她向我表示希望我甚么都不要说。

['ɪn.dɪ.keɪt] verb SIGNAL  发讯号  intransitive or transitive UK ■to show other road users that you intend to turn left or right when you are driving a vehicle 打方向灯指示（车行方向）transitive ■When a device indicates a value or change, it signals it 标示，显示
•The gauge indicates a temperature below freezing point.测量器显示温度在冰点以下。

['ɪn.dɪ.keɪt] verb SUGGEST  暗示  transitive ■to suggest something as being suitable 建议；显示；暗示
•specialized Antihistamine is indicated for this patient as a treatment for her allergies.该病人患过敏症，建议用抗组织胺来治疗。

•humorous I'm so hot and tired - I think a long cool drink is indicated!我又热又累——需要来一大杯冷饮！





manifest, indicate, illustrate

manifest: 表明、透露、清楚表示（show plainly）,显露（性质、感情） [反身用法]显示，出现（reveal）
indicate: 显示，
illustrate: 图例说明



denote, indicate, imply, mean, suggest, signify, represent

这组词都有“表示……的意思”的意思，其区别是：
denote: 指某一词字面或狭义的意思，或指某些符号或迹象的特指含义。
indicate: 指明显的表示。
imply: 侧重用文字或符号表示的联想，暗示。
mean: 最普通用词。指文字或符号等所表示的各种明确的或含蓄的意义。
suggest: 通常指暗含地、隐晦地表达意思。
signify: 指用文字、说话或表情等表示单纯的意思。
represent: 指体现或代表。



event, occasion, indicate, case

event: 重大事件
occasion: 场合，时刻，机关
indicate: 小事件
case: 事实，情况，实例


vt. 表明；指出；预示；象征
 - forecast, index, image, shadow, figure
examples: 英 ['ɪndɪkeɪt] 美 ['ɪndɪkeɪt]
v.指示；象征；显示；暗示，预示v.表明；指明

(1) This is used to indicate the temperature of the enclosure.(2) Sword indicates the bearer to a just and generous pursuit of honor and virtue in warlike deeds.(3) My car's gas gauge indicated that there was little gas left.(4) His hesitation indicates unwillingness.(5) A signpost indicated the right road for us .
(1) 这个用来指示壳体的温度。(2) 长剑象征剑的佩有者在格斗中具备公正、宽恕的美德。(3) 我车上的汽油表显示剩下的油不多了。(4) 他的犹豫表明不愿意。(5) 一个路标为我们指明了正确的路。
[sound:youdao-374b44c0-837a14b8-90b538b3-ff7adb6f-d169613d.mp3]

translation:
n. 指示; 象征; 表明; 标示

分布：迹象(43%)，指示(40%)，表示(17%)


n.指出,指示;表明,暗示There are indications that unemployment will decrease.有失业人数减少的迹象.



noun SIGN  标示   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■a sign that something exists, is true, or is likely to happen 标示；表明；象征
•There are few indications (that) the economy is on an upswing.没有甚么迹象显示经济正在好转。

•Helen's face gave no indication of what she was thinking.从海伦的脸上看不出她在想甚么。

[ˌɪn.dɪ'keɪ.ʃən] noun SUGGESTION  暗示  countable ■a suitable action that is suggested by something 暗示；显示；建议
•The indication from the trade figures is to reduce stock by at least 30%.贸易数字说明至少应减少30%的存货。





indication, symptom

这组词都有“征兆”的意思，其区别是：

symptom: 通常指作为医学诊断的病征兆。

(1) Did they give you any indication?(2) Did he give you any indication of his feelings?(3) There are some indications that the prices will rise.(4) There is every indication that the price will rise.

translation:
adj. 漠不关心的; 无关紧要的; 中立的; 中等的

分布：无关紧要的(41%)，漠不关心的(34%)，中立的(21%)，平凡的(4%)


→in-,不，非，different,不同的。即没有不同的，引申词义冷淡的。
冷漠的(in+different不同的→同与不同的"事不关已"→冷漠的)[im-,in-①表示"不,无,非"②表示"向内,进入"]
冷漠的,不关心的(in不+different不同→同与不同无所谓→冷漠的)[fer=bring,carry,表示"带来,拿来"]
a.冷漠的,不关心的,不积极的I infer that he is indifferent to differentiating the offers in different conferences.我推断他对区分不同会谈中的报价漠不关心.
【记】因为这些人的志向与我different（adj 不同的）所以我漠不关心【反】avid（adj 渴望的；热情的）avi飞，d的；fervor（n 热情；炽热）zealot（n 狂热者）；enraptured（adj 狂喜的）



US [-ɚ-] adjective NOT INTERESTED  不感兴趣的  ■not thinking about or interested in someone or something 不感兴趣的；不关心的，冷淡的
•Why don't you vote - how can you be so indifferent (to what is going on)!你为甚么不投票？你怎能（对正在发生的事情）如此漠不关心！

•He found it very hard teaching a class full of indifferent teenagers.他发觉教一班无动于衷的十几岁的孩子真是头痛。

UK [ɪn'dɪf.ər.ənt/ UK [-rənt] US [-ɚ-] adjective NOT GOOD  不好的  ■not good, but not very bad 中等的，一般的
•We didn't like the restaurant much - the food was indifferent and the service rather slow.我们不怎么喜欢这家餐馆——饭菜一般，上菜也相当慢。





different, indifferent

different: 跟……不一样，同from搭配。如：This book is different from that one.(这本书跟那本不一样。)
indifferent: 冷漠的，不关心的，同to搭配。如：He was indifferent to his personal appearance.(他从前不注意自己的外表。)


adj. 漠不关心的；无关紧要的；中性的，中立的
 - neutral, insignificant
examples: 英 [ɪn'dɪfrənt] 美 [ɪn'dɪfrənt]
adj.漠不关心的；无关紧要的；平凡的；中立的

(1) He is indifferent to the result of the exam.(2) She seems indifferent, but deep down she's very pleased.(3) Many one or little one is indifferent to me.(4) It was utterly indifferent to her who he was.(5) I'm an indifferent cook.(6) He remains indifferent in the dispute.
(1) 他对考试结果漠不关心。(2) 她貌似无动於衷，其实心里非常高兴。(3) 多一个或少一个对我是无关紧要的。(4) 封她来说，他是谁，根本是无关紧要的事。(5) 我是个手艺平平的厨师。(6) 他对争论表示中立。
[sound:youdao-0e73737c-b642359b-ea0003fa-e4ff0b1a-3a69e682.mp3]

translation:
adj. 愤怒的，愤慨的; 愤愤不平的; 激愤

分布：愤慨的(60%)，愤愤不平的(40%)


→in-,不，非，-dign,尊贵，价值，体面，词源同dignity,decent.即价值被贬低的，名声被侮辱的，引申词义被激怒的，愤怒的。
愤慨的,愤怒的(in不+dign+ant→不高贵的→愤怒是不高贵的)[dign=worthy,noble,表示"值得,高贵"]
a.愤慨的,愤慨不平的He is indignant beyond measure.他非常气愤.
【记】in不，dign尊严；高贵－愤怒的【参】dignity（n 尊严；高贵）；indign（adj 不值得的；不光彩的）【区】indignity（n 轻蔑；侮辱）



adjective ■angry because of something which is wrong or not fair 愤怒的，愤慨的
•She wrote an indignant letter to the paper complaining about the council's action.她给报纸写了一封义愤填膺的信抗议市政会的做法。

•He became very indignant when it was suggested he had made a mistake.当有人提出他犯了错误时，他非常生气。





angry, indignant, mad

这些形容词均有“发怒的，愤怒的”之意。
angry: 侧重以愤怒的表情、激烈的言辞或威胁的目光等来表达感情。
indignant: 侧重愤怒是有充分理由和正当的。
mad: 多用于非正式文体和讲话中，与angry意义相近。


adj. 愤愤不平的；义愤的
 - aggrieved
examples: 英 [ɪn'dɪɡnənt] 美 [ɪn'dɪɡnənt]
adj.愤慨的；愤愤不平的
(1) People are indignant by their shooting of innocent civilians.(2) He is indignant at the false accusation.
(1) 对于他们枪杀无辜平民，人们感到义愤填膺。(2) 他对被诬告愤愤不平。
[sound:youdao-0038fc6e-4b8e8b02-ef2da61e-f188376d-a77757eb (1).mp3]

translation:
adj. 间接的; 不直截了当的; 闪烁其词的; 不坦率的

分布：间接的(73%)，迂回的(13%)，不坦率的(9%)，次要的(5%)


→in-,不，非，direct,直接的。



adjective NOT OBVIOUS  不明显的  ■happening in addition to an intended result, often in a way that is complicated or not obvious 间接的
•The benefits from pure research are often indirect.纯理论研究带来的益处常常是间接的。

•Indirect effects of the fighting include disease and food shortages.战争的间接后果包括疾病肆虐及食物短缺。
■avoiding clearly mentioning or saying something 旁敲侧击的
•indirect criticism旁敲侧击的批评

[ˌɪn.daɪ'rekt] adjective NOT STRAIGHT  不直的  ■not following a straight line, or not directly or simply connected 迂回的，曲折的
•to take an indirect route/flight走迂回路线／乘非直航航班




adj. [试验] 间接的；迂回的；非直截了当的
 - circular, consequential
examples: 英 [ˌɪndə'rekt] 美 [ˌɪndə'rekt]
adj.间接的；迂回的；次要的；不坦率的

(1) The effect may be direct or indirect.(2) The accident was the indirect result of the train being late.(3) I got informed by an indirect way.(4) She gave an indirect to my question.(5) His indirect way of telling me to leave annoyed me.
(1) 这种影响是直接的或间接的。(2) 引发事故的间接原因是火车晚点。(3) 我通过迂回的途径得到这个消息。(4) 她兜着圈子回答我的问题。(5) 他那种不直截了当地让我离开的方式激怒了我。
[sound:youdao-7cf8d748-436b9d9e-154b8a09-dbecfe8c-12478b2d.mp3]

translation:
adj. 不可缺少的; 绝对必要的; 责无旁贷的; 不可避开的
n. 不可缺少的人或物

分布：不可缺少的(100%)


→in-,不，非，dispensable,可省去的，可有可无的。
a.(to,for)必不可少的,必需的Computer is indispensable to modern life.计算机是现代生活中不可缺少的东西.



adjective ■Something or someone that is indispensable is so good or important that you could not manage without them 必不可少的，必需的
•This book is an indispensable resource for researchers.这本书是研究人员必不可少的资料。

•His long experience at the United Nations makes him indispensable to the talks.在联合国长期的工作经验使他成为谈判中不可或缺的人物。





requisite, essential, indispensable, necessary

这组词都有“必不可少的，必需的”的意思，其区别是：
requisite: 正式用词，特指为实现某一目的或得到某种结果而应有的需要，有时可与necessary换用。
essential: 指对事物本身性质具有决定性的重要性，暗含不可缺少，否则便无法存在。
indispensable: 语气强，侧重指绝对必要性或不可缺少性。
necessary: 最常用词，侧重由客观因素决定的某种需要，强调不可避免，但并非绝不可缺少。


adj. 不可缺少的；绝对必要的；责无旁贷的
 - obbligato
examples: 英 [ˌɪndɪ'spensəbl] 美 [ˌɪndɪ'spensəbl]
adj.不可缺少的

(1) The computer is now an indispensable tool in many businesses.(2) Air is indispensable to life.(3) A good dictionary is indispensable for learning a foreign language.(4) Air, food and water are indispensable to life.
(1) 目前计算机是很多公司不可或缺的用具。(2) 空气是生命所必需的东西。(3) 学习外语离不开好的词典。(4) 空气，食物，水皆为生命不可缺者。
[sound:youdao-71bf46b7-b0b23db3-7ff8c5df-cf7575c6-c323208e.mp3]

translation:
adj. 个人的; 独特的; 个别的
n. 个人; 个体

分布：个人(68%)，个体(21%)，单独的(9%)，一个人的(1%)，独有的(1%)


→in-,不，非，divide,分开，分割。即不可分割的，原指耶稣的圣父，圣灵，圣子三位一体不可分开，后用来指单个的人，个人，个体。
个人的,个体的(in不+divide+ual→不能再分开了→个人)[vid,vis=separate,表示"分开"]
a.个人的,单独的;独特的n.个人,个体The hidden division is subdivided into individuals.隐藏的师被细分为个体.



noun countable SINGLE  单个   ESSENTIAL  ■a single person or thing, especially when compared to the group or set to which they belong 个人，个体
•Every individual has rights which must never be taken away.每个人都有一些不可剥夺的权利。

•Like many creative individuals, she can be very bad-tempered.像许多富有创造力的人一样，她的脾气有时会很不好。

•We try to treat our students as individuals.我们力图把学生当成独立的个体来对待。

[ˌɪn.dɪ'vɪd.ju.əl] noun countable DIFFERENT  不同的  ■a person who thinks or behaves in their own original way （思想或行为）与众不同的人，有个性的人
•If nothing else, the school will turn her into an individual.即使不能有其他建树，这所学校至少会将她培养成一个有其独特气质的人。

[ˌɪn.dɪ'vɪd.ju.əl] adjective SINGLE  单个   ESSENTIAL  [before noun] ■existing and considered separately from the other things or people in a group 个体的，个人的
•Each individual table is finished by hand.每一张桌子都是手工制的。
 ESSENTIAL  [before noun] ■given to or relating to a single, separate person or thing 单个的
•We deal with each case on an individual basis.我们单独处理每个病例。

[ˌɪn.dɪ'vɪd.ju.əl] adjective DIFFERENT  不同的  ■belonging or relating to, or suitable for, people or things that are different or particular in some way 独特的，特有的
•children with individual needs有各自需求的孩子

•Marion has a very individual writing style.玛丽安的写作风格与众不同。





distinctive, peculiar, individual, characteristic

这组词都有“特有的，显示特征的”的意思，其区别是：
distinctive: 突出与众不同的或令人称赞的个性或特征。
peculiar: 侧重指某人或某物本身与众不同；也可指种族、民族或性别，着重有其无可争议的特点。
individual: 指特指的人或物，着重其与众不同，强调可将其区别出的品质与特性。
characteristic: 侧重指具有区别能力，典型的或本质的事物。



personal, individual, private

这组词都有“个人的，私人的”的意思，其区别是：
personal: 指属于或关于某人或某些特定的人，以区别于其他人。
individual: 与集体的相对，指个别或个体的。
private: 指属于私人所有或具有私营性质，以区别于集体或公共的，有时含不公开的意味。



individual, native, people, inhabitant

individual: 个人，有某种特点的人
native: 本地人，出生于某国（或某地）的人
people: 民族，种族，部落
inhabitant: （某地的）居民


adj. [经] 个人的；个别的；独特的
 - personal, different, subjective, distinct, unique
n. [经] 个人， [生物] 个体
 - unity, private person
examples: 英 [ˌɪndɪ'vɪdʒuəl] 美 [ˌɪndɪ'vɪdʒuəl]
adj.单独的；一个人的；独有的n.个人；个体

(1) A teacher can't give individual attention to each pupil if his class is large.(2) It is difficult for a teacher to give individual attention to children in a large class.(3) She has her own individual style of doing things.(4) No individual shall overtop the law.(5) Exceptions can not be made for individuals.(6) What does it mean to be a unique human individual?
(1) 如果班上的人数多，老师就不能给予个别辅导了。(2) 教师在人数多的班上，很难对各个学生都照顾到。(3) 她有自己独特的行事风格。(4) 任何个人的权力都不能凌驾于法律之上。(5) 对个人不能有例外。(6) 成为一个独特的个体意味着什么?
[sound:youdao-5c167bc5-65a33abd-85b37965-d6d78d55-7db66498.mp3]

translation:
adj. 工业的，产业的; 从事工业的; 供工业用的; 来自勤劳的
n. 工业股票; 工业工人

分布：工业的(57%)，产业的(31%)，工业公司(12%)


→来自industry,工业。
a.工业的,产业的The dust in the industrial zone frustrated the industrious man.工业区里的灰尘使勤勉的人灰心.



adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■in or related to industry, or having a lot of industry and factories, etc 工业的；产业的
•industrial output工业产量

•industrial expansion工业扩张

•an industrial landscape/nation工业地貌／国家

•He has an industrial background (= He has worked in industry).他在工业领域工作过。

[ɪn'dʌs.tri.əl] noun countable specialized ■a company whose main business is producing goods, or a share in such a company when it is traded on the stock market 从事工业的公司；工业股票
•He owns a series of industrials across the US and beyond.他在美国以及其他地区拥有一系列工业公司。

•Industrials were up 1.2% at the close of trading.在交易结束的时候工业股票上升了1.2个百分点。
industrials [plural noun] * shares in industrial companies •On Thursday the industrials moved up more than 50 points.   




industrious, industrial

industrious: 勤劳的，勤奋的。如：He is an industrious student.(他是个用功的学生。)
industrial: 工业的，产业的。如：Italy is becoming an industrial nation.(意大利逐步成为工业国。)
examples: 英 [ɪn'dʌstriəl] 美 [ɪn'dʌstriəl]
adj.工业的；产业的n.工业公司

(1) She is an industrial designer.(2) The industrial exposition will be held on September.(3) The industrial revolution had taken place in England first.(4) Due to low investment, our industrial output has remained stagnant.(5) The industrial structure of our country is gradually changing.(6) He troubleshoots for a large industrial firm.(7) This unit is set machinery manufacturing as one of refractories and industrial companies.
(1) 她是工业设计师。(2) 工业博览会将于九月召开。(3) 工业革命首先在英国发生。(4) 由于投资少，我们的工业生产一直停滞不前。(5) 我国的产业结构正在逐渐改变。(6) 他受雇为一家大工业公司检修故障。(7) 本单位是集机械制造和耐火材料为一体的工业公司。
[sound:youdao-95e388e2-8baf224e-228e938b-51d3b601-cf0016c2.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. （使）工业化

时态：industrialized, industrializing, industrializes
分布：动词(100%)


→来自industry,工业。
工业化(industrial工业的+ize)[-ise 1.表动词后缀,和-ize相同,是-ize的变体,"…化"2.表名词"物品,状态"]
v.(industrialise)(使)工业化The country has been steadily industrializing.这个国家一直在稳步实现工业化.



(UK usually industrialise) [ɪn'dʌs.tri.ə.laɪz] verb intransitive or transitive ■to develop industry （使）工业化
•It was the first country to industrialize.这是第一个实现工业化的国家。

(1) Many townships in the coastal area have begin to industrialize.(2) We have to make our every effort to industrialize our country.
(1) 沿海地区的许多乡镇已开始工业化。(2) 我们应该尽最大的努力，使我们的国家工业化。

translation:
n. 工业; 产业（经济词汇）; 工业界; 勤劳

分布：工业(42%)，行业(35%)，产业(18%)，勤劳(3%)，勤勉(2%)


→来自拉丁语industria,行动，勤奋，热情，来自indu-,在内，在里，第二部分词源不确定，可能来自-stru,建造，建设，词源同structure,instruct,或来自-ust,燃烧，词源同combust.引申词义燃烧的热情，勤奋，后用来指制造，制造业，工业，行业。
n.工业,产业;勤劳,勤奋Our automobile industry is expanding.我们的汽车工业在发展.



noun PRODUCTION  生产   ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■the companies and activities involved in the process of producing goods for sale, especially in a factory or special area 工业；产业；生产制造
•trade and industry贸易和工业

•industry and commerce工商业

•The city needs to attract more industry.这个城市需要吸引更多的工业。

•The strike seriously reduced coal deliveries to industry.罢工使得向工业输送的煤炭量大幅下降。

['ɪn.də.stri] noun TYPE OF WORK  行业   ESSENTIAL  countable ■the people and activities involved in one type of business 行业
•the gas/electricity industry燃气业／电力工业

•the tourist industry旅游业

•manufacturing industries制造业

•The computer industry has been booming.电脑行业已经日益蓬勃起来了。
countable disapproving ■something which is produced or available in large quantities and which makes a lot of money （暴利的）行当
•the heritage industry遗产产业

['ɪn.də.stri] noun QUALITY  素质  uncountable formal ■the quality of regularly working hard 勤奋；勤劳
•I must say that I'm very impressed by her industry.我必须承认，她的勤奋给我留下了很深的印象。




n. 产业； [工业] 工业；勤勉
 - domain, manufacturing
examples: 英 ['ɪndəstri] 美 ['ɪndəstri]
n.工业；产业；行业；勤勉；勤劳

(1) Since the advent of atomic power, there have been great changes in industry.(2) The tourist trade has become a real industry.(3) The information industry is an infant industry in our country.(4) He wants to widen his knowledge of the industry.(5) Success comes with industry.(6) Industry sometimes compensates for lack of ability.(7) His success was due to his industry.
(1) 自从原子动力问世以后，工业发生了巨大的变化。(2) 旅游业已经成为真正的产业。(3) 信息产业在我国是新兴产业。(4) 他想扩充自己在这一行业的知识。(5) 成功来自勤奋。(6) 勤勉有时可以弥补能力之不足。(7) 他由于勤劳而获得成功。

translation:
adj. 无效率的，无能的; 不称职的; 徒劳的

分布：无效率的(47%)，无能的(30%)，不称职的(23%)


→in-,不，非，efficient,有效率的。



adjective ■not organized, skilled or able to work satisfactorily 低效率的；能力差的
•Existing methods of production are expensive and inefficient.现行的生产方法既昂贵效率又低。

•I'm hopelessly inefficient at mending things.我永远也不会修理东西。





insufficient, inefficient, incompetent, ineffective

insufficient: 不充分的
inefficient: 效率低的
incompetent: 不胜任的
ineffective: 无效果的


adj. 无效率的，效率低的；无能的
 - helpless, talentless
examples: 英 [ˌɪnɪ'fɪʃnt] 美 [ˌɪnɪ'fɪʃnt]

(1) A second limit on the private-equity recovery is the cockroach-like survival of the region's big and inefficient conglomerates.(2) There are too many inefficient workers in the factory.

translation:
adj. 不可避免的; 必然发生的; <非正>总会发生的; 必然发生的事

分布：不可避免的(100%)


→in-,不，非，e-,向外，-vit,分开，离开，词源同divide,widow.即不可离开的，引申词义无可避免的。
a.不可避免的,必然发生的Death is inevitable.死是无法避免的.



US [-tˌə-] adjective  IMPROVER  ■certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented 不可避免的；必然发生的
•The accident was the inevitable consequence/result/outcome of carelessness.这次意外是粗心导致的必然结果。
the inevitable ■something that is certain to happen and cannot be prevented 不可避免的情况；逃避不了的事实
•Eventually the inevitable happened and he had a heart attack.最终不可避免的情况还是发生了——他心脏病发作。




adj. 必然的，不可避免的
 - certain, necessary, automatic
examples: 英 [ɪn'evɪtəbl] 美 [ɪn'evɪtəbl]
adj.不可避免的；必然(发生)的
(1) You'll have to bow to the inevitable.(2) But most agree that change is inevitable.
(1) 你将不得不向不可避免的事态低头。(2) 但她们多数人同意改变是不可避免的。

translation:
n. 婴儿，幼儿; 未成年人; 初学者，生手
adj. 婴儿的，幼儿的; 幼稚的，幼小的; 初期的; 未成年的

分布：婴儿(70%)，幼儿(16%)，婴儿的(11%)，幼稚的(2%)，初期的(1%)


→in-,不，非，-fan,说话，词源同phone,fame.即不能说话的，引申词义婴儿。
n.婴儿,幼儿To the ants, the infant elephant is a giant in the plantation.对蚂蚁们来说,幼小的大象是种植园里的庞然大物.



noun YOUNG CHILD  婴儿   ADVANCED  countable ■a baby or a very young child 婴儿
•a newborn infant新生儿

['ɪn.fənt] noun SCHOOL  学校  countable UK ■a student at an infant school 幼儿学校的学生
•Jenny is a top-year infant now.珍妮现在是一所幼儿学校的大班生。
the infants [plural] UK ■infant school  幼儿学校
•Andrew's still in the infants.安德鲁还在上幼儿学校。

['ɪn.fənt] adjective UK ■related to or connected with the first stage of school in the UK, for children aged 4 to 7 years 学前班的，幼儿的
•an infant teacher/class幼儿教师／学前班
⇒ See also junior school




child, youngster, infant, baby

这组词都有“孩子”的意思，其区别是：
child: 普通用词，含义广，无感情色彩。泛指从胎儿、婴儿到10岁左右的儿童。
youngster: 泛指任何年龄的儿童或者少年，多指男孩，多为年长者的使用。
infant: 书面用词，狭义指出生后到两岁的小孩，广义指7岁以下的孩子；法律上则指未到法定年龄。
baby: 日常用词，一般指从刚出生的婴儿到满两岁的或非常小的孩子，常含钟爱意味。


n. 婴儿；幼儿；未成年人
 - baby, minor
adj. 婴儿的；幼稚的；初期的；未成年的
 - earlier, young, baby, minor, tender
examples: 英 ['ɪnfənt] 美 ['ɪnfənt]
n.婴儿；幼儿adj.婴儿的；初期的；幼稚的

(1) She gazed at the newborn infant and smiled.(2) My sister's infant is very lovely.(3) A 35-day-old male infant was scheduled for bilateral inguinal herniorrhaphy.(4) Infant family education is an important education environment which can't be irreplaceable by preschool education and social education.(5) Infant mortality is still very high in some developing countries.(6) Infant industry is vulnerable to the attack from foreign mature industry.
(1) 她望着这个初生的婴儿笑了。(2) 我姐姐的小婴儿非常可爱。(3) 摘要一个三十五天大的幼儿接受二沟腹股沟疝气门诊手术。(4) 幼儿家庭教育是幼儿园教育和社会教育所不能替代的重要教育环境。(5) 某些发展中国家的婴儿死亡率仍然很高。(6) 未成熟工业容易受到外来成熟工业的影响。
[sound:youdao-a26a3655-7c36c91d-69af1731-66e1efd5-cffb8a5a.mp3]

translation:
vt. 使受影响，感染; 传染，散布病毒，侵染; （电脑病毒）使（电脑的）存储器[数据]受到感染

时态：infected, infecting, infects
分布：感染(79%)，传染(21%)


→in-,进入，使，-fect,做，产生，词源同affect,effect.引申词义做进去的，传染，感染，影响。
传染;感化(in进入+fact→做进去→传染进去)[fac,fact,fect,fic,fig=make,do,表示"做,制作"]
vt.传染,感染;影响(思想等)His flu infected his wife.他把流行性感冒传染给妻子.



verb transitive DISEASE  疾病  ■to pass a disease to a person, animal or plant （疾病）传染，感染
•The ward was full of children infected with TB.病房里住满了感染结核病的孩子。

•All the tomato plants are infected with a virus.所有的番茄植株都染上了一种病毒。

[ɪn'fekt] verb transitive FEELING  情感  ■to make someone have the same feeling or emotion as you （情感）感染（别人）；使受影响
•Her optimism seemed to infect all those around her.她的乐观情绪似乎感染了周围所有的人。

[ɪn'fekt] verb transitive COMPUTERS  电脑  ■to pass harmful programs from one computer to another, or within files in the same computer （电脑病毒）感染
•A computer virus may lurk unseen in a computer's memory, calling up and infecting each of the machine's data files in turn.电脑病毒可潜伏在电脑记忆体中，依次调出并感染电脑中的每一个资料文档。




vt. [医] 感染，传染
 - affect, contract, catch, disease, communicate
examples: 英 [ɪn'fekt] 美 [ɪn'fekt]
vt.传染；感染

(1) The open wound soon became infected.(2) The flu virus infected almost the entire class.(3) There is a virus that infects word-processing documents recently.(4) Her cheerful spirits and bubble laughter infect the whole class.(5) The young teacher infected the whole class with her enthusiasm.
(1) 裸露的伤口很快就受到了感染。(2) 全班几乎人人都染上了流行性感冒病毒。(3) 最近有种病毒专门传染WORD文件。(4) 她那快乐的情绪和爽朗的笑声感染了全班。(5) 这位年轻的老师以她的热诚感染了全班。
[sound:youdao-947a05f9-6be319e8-7ddb94e7-abc0d3c1-ccc94c08.mp3]

translation:
vt. 推断; 猜想，推理; 暗示; 意指
vi. 作出推论

时态：inferred, inferring, infers
分布：推断(88%)，暗示(6%)，作出推论(4%)，猜测(2%)


→in-,进入，使，-fer,带来，词源同bring.即带进来的，引申词义推断，推论。
推理,推断(in进入+fer→带进[意义]→推断)[fer=bring,carry,表示"带来,拿来"]
v.推论,推断I infer that he is indifferent to differentiating the offers in different conferences.我推断他对区分不同会谈中的报价漠不关心.
【记】in里面，fer带来一带来内部的意义－推断；推测



US [-'fɝ:] (-rr-) formal verb transitive ■to form an opinion or guess that something is true because of the information that you have 推断，推论，推理
•What do you infer from her refusal?你从她的拒绝中能推断出甚么？

•[+ that] I inferred from her expression that she wanted to leave.从她的表情我可判断出她想离开。





conclude, judge, gather, infer, deduce

这组词都有“推断”的意思，其区别是：
conclude: 指得出符合逻辑的结论。
judge: 多指经过仔细鉴定或评价之后作出决断。
gather: 指从听到的情况推测、判定。
infer: 指从已提供的论据或从已接受的前提出发而推断出的结论。
deduce: 指有充分根据的推论，也指逻辑学上的演绎。



infer, imply

infer: v. (根据已知事实)推断，推理。
 • I infer from your smile that you are happy.   从你的笑容可以看出你很高兴。
imply: v. (从言语或态度中)暗示，暗指(某种事情)。
 • The Secretary of the Treasury implied that interest rates would go down.   财政大臣暗示利率将下降。


vt. 推断；推论
 - understand, conclude, reason
vi. 推断；作出推论
 - conclude, deduce from
examples: 英 [ɪn'fɜː(r)] 美 [ɪn'fɜːr]
vt.推断；猜测；暗示vi.作出推论
(1) They infer a conclusion from the facts.(2) I infer that my proposal has been accepted.(3) Ragged clothing infers poverty.(4) We can infer from his expression that he is frustrated.
(1) 他们从事实中推断出结论。(2) 我推测我的建议已被接受。(3) 衣衫褴褛意味着贫困。(4) 我们可以从他的表情中推断出他很沮丧。
[sound:youdao-87ee3d2d-4da5f296-2c1fd15e-9ebd2176-eea1ad7e.mp3]

translation:
adj. （质量等）低劣的; 下级的，下等的; （位置在）下面的; [植]下位的
n. 部下，下属; 次品; 晚辈; [印]下角码

分布：下级(37%)，下级的(18%)，属下(16%)，较低的(13%)，次等的(11%)，不如的(5%)


→来自拉丁语infra,在下面的，低的，词源同nether,-ior,比较级后缀。即更下的，更低的，引申词义低等的。
低下的(infer下面)[-ior表形容词"较…的"]
a.下等的,下级的;劣等的,差的n.下级,晚辈During this serious period, the superior asked the inferior a series of questions about the supermarket.在这段严肃时间内,上级问了下级一连串有关超级市场的问题.



US [-'fɪr.i.ɚ] adjective ■not good, or not as good as someone or something else 差的；比…次的
•These products are inferior to those we bought last year.这些产品比我们去年买的差些。

•She cited cases in which women had received inferior health care.她引用了一些妇女得到低劣保健服务的事例。

•It was clear the group were regarded as intellectually/morally/socially inferior.很明显的是，这个群体被认为在智力／道德水准／社会地位上很低下。
 Compare superior specialized■lower, or of lower rank 低级别的，下级的
•an inferior officer下级官员
 Compare superior




minor, inferior, secondary, subordinate

这组词都有“次等”的意思，其区别是：
minor: a较少的，较小的，较次要的，常含有轻微的但并非不重要的意思。
 • We agreed on everything in the contract, even minor points.   我们对合同中的一切问题，甚至是细枝末节都达成了一致。
inferior: a.次等的，较劣的，差的，当"下级"讲时，强调职位的高低；当"次等"讲时，指素质、质量等的低劣。
 • Most wine from Switzerland is inferior to wine from France.   产于瑞士的葡萄酒多数要比法国的差。
secondary: a.第二等的，次要的，强调在重要性或顺序上处于第二位。
 • My job is of secondary importance to my health.   我的工作比起身体来说不那么重要。
subordinate: a.次要的，从属的，下级的，强调主次地位或支配和隶属的关系。
 • He was always friendly to his subordinate officers.   她对下级官员一向和蔼可亲。


adj. 差的；自卑的； [植] 下级的，下等的
 - junior, lower
n. 下级；次品
 - lessness, subordinate
examples: 英 [ɪn'fɪəriə(r)] 美 [ɪn'fɪriər]
adj.较低的；次等的；不如的；下级的n.下级；属下；[印]下标符号

(1) These people occupy an inferior position in local society.(2) Captain is an inferior rank to major.(3) A cheaper camera is not always inferior to a more expensive one.(4) They never sell inferior goods.(5) Woman is inferior to man in strength.(6) He's so clever, he makes me feel inferior.(7) She liked to pull her rank on her inferior.
(1) 这些人在当地社会居于下等地位。(2) 上尉是低于少校的一个官阶(3) 廉价照相机的质量并总不比昂贵的差。(4) 他们从不销售次货。(5) 女人力量不及男人。(6) 他那么聪明，让我自愧不如。(7) 她喜欢对其下属摆威风、耍架子。
[sound:youdao-53bf229d-0802ef90-c904613e-09fcfdec-94fd4531.mp3]

translation:
adj. 无限的，无穷的; 无数的，许许多多的; 极大的
n. 无限，无穷; [数] 无穷大; <宗>造物主，神; 无限的事物

分布：无限(63%)，无限的(27%)，无穷的(10%)


→in-,不，非，finite,有限的。
无限的(in无+finite)[fin=end,boundary,表示"结束,范围"]
a.无限的,无穷的n.无限Time is finite and infinite. I defy the indefinite definition.时间既是有限的又是无限的.我公然对抗这个模糊的定义.
【记】in无，fin范围－无范围的－无限的【区】infinitesimal（adj 无穷小的n 极小量）；finite（adj 有限的）



adjective ■without limits; extremely large or great 无限的，无边的；极大的
•an infinite number/variety无数／种类繁多

•The universe is theoretically infinite.从理论上来讲，宇宙是无边无际的。

•With infinite patience , she explained the complex procedure to us.她以极大的耐心向我们解释这个复杂的程式。

['ɪn.fɪ.nət] adjective in sb's infinite wisdom disapproving ■used to show that you do not understand why someone has done something and that you think it was a stupid action 以（某人）无比的智慧（表示不明白某人为甚么做了让人觉得很傻的事）
•The authorities, in their infinite wisdom, decided to close the advice centre.当局以其无比的智慧决定关闭咨询中心。

['ɪn.fɪ.nət] noun the Infinite ■God 上帝



adj. 无限的， [数] 无穷的；无数的；极大的
 - huge, tremendous, thousand, million, boundless
n. 无限； [数] 无穷大；无限的东西（如空间，时间）
 - Mugen, immenseness
examples: 英 ['ɪnfɪnət] 美 ['ɪnfɪnət]
adj.无穷的；无限的n.无限

(1) The number of positive numbers is infinite.(2) Teaching little children takes infinite patience.(3) It is difficult to grasp the concept of infinite space.(4) Incense can attune the finite to the Infinite.(5) The totality of space could be infinite.
(1) 正数的数目是无穷的。(2) 教幼儿需有极大的耐心。(3) 掌握无限空间的概念是很难的。(4) 薰香可以使有限调谐至无限。(5) 整个空间其实可以是无限大的。
[sound:youdao-43cfe33f-f6a9028b-5f959e6b-d5ebc864-2eec9e61.mp3]

translation:
n. 影响; 势力; 有影响的人（或事物）; [占星学]星力
vt. 影响; 感染; 支配; 对…起作用

时态：influenced, influencing, influences
分布：影响(91%)，影响力(5%)，势力(2%)，权势(1%)，感染(1%)


→in-,进入，使，-flu,流动，词源同fluid,fluent.即流进，引申词义影响。
影响(in进入+flu+ence→流入→影响)[flu=flow,表示"流动"]
n.(on)影响,感化;势力,权势v.影响,感化His influence is insignificant.他的影响力微不足道.



noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the power to have an effect on people or things, or a person or thing that is able to do this 影响，作用；有影响的人（或物）
•Helen's a bad/good influence on him.海伦对他有不良／好的影响。

•He has a huge amount of influence over the city council.他对市政委员会有着巨大的影响。

•Christopher hoped to exert his influence to make them change their minds.克里斯多夫希望利用自己的影响力迫使他们改变主意。

•At the time she was under the influence of her father.她当时受到父亲的影响。

['ɪn.flu.ənts] noun countable or uncountable under the influence ■drunk 喝醉的
•Driving under the influence is a very serious offence.醉酒驾车属于严重违规。

['ɪn.flu.ənts] verb transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to affect or change how someone or something develops, behaves or thinks 影响
•She's very good at making friends and influencing people.她很擅长交友并对他人施加影响。

•[+ obj + to infinitive] What influenced you to choose a career in nursing?甚么使你选择了护士这个职业？





affect, influence, impress

这些动词均含“影响”之意。
affect: 作主语通常是物而不是人，指一物对另一物产生的消极影响。
influence: 侧重在思想、性格、行为等方面所产生的潜移默化的影响，也可指自然力的影响。
impress: 强调影响既深刻又持久。



effect, validity, influence, efficiency

effect: 指某人或某事的影响产生特殊“效果”
validity: 有效性，合法性
influence: 强调“潜移默化”的影响
efficiency: 效率



effect, influence, affect

effect: n. 功效，影响 v. 产生，实现（目的）等
influence: v. 潜移默化的影响人的行为，性格，观点
affect: v. 对…..产生不良影响


n. 影响；势力；感化；有影响的人或事
 - effect, infection, impression, affection, incidence
vt. 影响；改变
 - affect, impact of, impact on, reach, fashion
examples: 英 ['ɪnfluəns] 美 ['ɪnfluəns]
v.影响；感染；在(饮料)中加烈酒n.影响力；影响；权势；势力；有影响的人(或事物)

(1) Don't let me ilfnuence your decision.(2) The labour enthusiasm of the workers strongly influenced us.(3) He makes a nice drink for women by influencing orange juice.(4) His influence is on the ebb.(5) This event had a pernicious influence on society.(6) His parents no longer have any real influence over him.(7) Mr. Smith is a man of influence in this town.(8) He has extended his sphere of influence to the world of banking.(9) He is an influence for good.
(1) 不要让我影响你的决定。(2) 工人们的劳动热情极大地感染了我们。(3) 他在橘子汁里加了少量烈性酒即制成了适于女性的爽口饮料。(4) 他的影响力逐渐在衰退。(5) 这件事情对社会造成了有害的影响。(6) 他的父母对他不再有任何真正的约束力了。(7) 史密斯先生是这个镇上有权势的人物。(8) 他已把自己的势力范围扩展到金融界。(9) 他是一个发挥良好作用的人。
[sound:youdao-962db20e-10e948bb-b1e195ce-80148e0f-6e2fc390.mp3]

translation:
adj. 有影响的; 有权势的
n. 有影响力的人物

分布：有影响的(74%)，有权势的(16%)，有影响力的人物(10%)


a.有影响的;有权势的The flu influenced the influential speaker's fluency of speech.流感影响了那个有影响的讲话者讲话的流畅.



adjective  ADVANCED  ■having a lot of influence on someone or something 更有影响的
•She wanted to work for a bigger and more influential (= powerful) newspaper.她希望为一家规模和影响力更大的报纸工作。

•Johnson was influential (= important) in persuading the producers to put money into the film.詹森在说服制作人投资拍摄此片方面起了重要作用。




adj. 有影响的；有势力的
 - mighty, predominant
examples: 英 [ˌɪnflu'enʃl] 美 [ˌɪnflu'enʃl]
adj.有权势的；有影响的n.有影响力的人物

(1) He used his influential friends to help him get into the civil service by the back door.(2) Influential friends helped him to get a good job.(3) She uses her influential friends to get jobs.(4) Our newspaper is an influential newspaper in this city.(5) He is an influential figure in early 20th-century.(6) He is a very influential man in the government.(7) His father is an influential democrat.(8) He met a select group of media influentials.
(1) 他利用那些有权有势的朋友帮助他走后门,到政府行政部门任职。(2) 有权势的朋友们帮他弄到一份美差。(3) 她利用有势力的朋友找到工作。(4) 我们的报纸在本市有很大影响力。(5) 他是二十世纪初具有影响的人物。(6) 他在政府中是个很有影响的人物。(7) 他父亲是有影响的民主党人。(8) 他会见了一群经过挑选的媒介巨头。
[sound:youdao-d9cb4617-73a0c5ec-393f2494-8817e2a3-5a1e1bdf.mp3]

translation:
vt. 通知; 使活跃，使充满; 预示
vi. 通知; 告发

时态：informed, informing, informs
分布：通知(74%)，告诉(21%)，告发(4%)，使熟悉(1%)


→in-,进入，使，form,形成。其原义使成形，训练，后引申词义教导，教育，说明，通知。引申演变比较instruct.
通知,告知(in进+form→进入形式→正式通知)[form=shape,表示"形状"]
v.(of,about)通知,告诉,报告;告发,告密The bookworm in uniform is informed of the storm.穿制服的书呆子得到暴风雨的消息.



US [-'fɔ:rm] verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to tell someone about particular facts 通知，告知
•The name of the dead man will not be released until his relatives have been informed.在通知死者亲属之前，不会公布死者的姓名。

•Why wasn't I informed about this earlier?为甚么不早点将这件事通知我？

•Walters was not properly informed of the reasons for her arrest.沃尔特斯并未按规定被告知其被捕的原因。

•[+ that] I informed my boss that I was going to be away next week.我告诉老板下周我不在。

UK [ɪn'fɔ:m] US [-'fɔ:rm] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   inform against/on sb ■If you inform on/against someone, you give the police information, usually secretly, about that person, showing that he or she has done something wrong （向警方）告发（某人）
•The terrorists said that anyone caught informing on them would be killed.恐怖分子说，举报他们的人一经发现将性命不保。

UK [ɪn'fɔ:m] US [-'fɔ:rm] verb transitive   Common Learner Errors   informRemember: inform  must have a direct object.Don't say 'inform about/of something', say inform someone about/of something :✗ I am writing to inform that I am leaving.I am writing to inform you that I am leaving.




inform, notify, advise, acquaint

这组词都有“通知、告知”的意思，其区别是：
inform: 普通用词，指传达事实或信息，或指经过研究或调查而获得的事实或信息。
notify: 指正式通知需要注意的事情。
advise: 指正式通知某件重要事，所通知的事情与被通知的人有关。
acquaint: 指提供有关信息或情况使某人熟悉某些过程或复杂的情况。


vt. 通知；告诉；报告
 - message, bring in on
vi. 告发；告密
 - tell on, blow the whistle
examples: 英 [ɪn'fɔːm] 美 [ɪn'fɔːrm]
v.通知；告诉；使熟悉；告发；赋特征于

(1) If you see something suspicious, inform the police at once.(2) I wasn't informed of the decision until it was too late.(3) The UN Associations work to inform the public about the role the UN plays in global affairs.(4) His poetry is deeply informed by the experience of poverty.
(1) 你要是看到什么可疑的东西就马上通知警察。(2) 等到我得知这项决定时,已经太迟了。(3) 联合国协会致力于使公众了解联合国在全球事务中发挥的作用。(4) 他的诗歌里带有过去贫困经历的烙印。
[sound:youdao-3061c101-0cdf4108-1c34e1ed-39c4f4c1-0bfc7432.mp3]

translation:
n. 信息，数据; 通知; 消息; 知识

分布：信息(79%)，资料(12%)，情报(6%)，通知(3%)


→来自inform,通知。引申词义信息，资讯。
信息,情报(inform+ation→通知的东西→信息)[form=shape,表示"形状"]
n.通知,报告;情报,资料,消息;信息I have firsthand information.我有第一手资料.



US [-fɚ-] (informal info) noun uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■facts about a situation, person, event, etc 情报；资料；消息
•Do you have any information about/on train times?你知道有关火车时刻的资讯吗？

•I read an interesting bit/piece of information in the newspaper.我在报纸上看到一则有趣的消息。

•For further information (= if you want to know more) , please contact your local library.欲知详情，请联络当地图书馆。

•[+ that] We have reliable information that a strike is planned next month.我们有可靠消息说下个月将有罢工。

UK [ˌɪn.fə'meɪ.ʃən] US [-fɚ-] (informal info) noun uncountable Too much information informal ■used when you want to tell someone that what they have said should be kept private or is embarrassing 话太多了！
UK [ˌɪn.fə'meɪ.ʃən] US [-fɚ-] (informal info) noun uncountable   Common Learner Errors   informationInformation   does not have a plural form and cannot be used with a  or an.To talk about an amount of information , do not say 'informations', say information , some information or a lot of information :✗ I found a lot of useful informations on their website.I found a lot of useful information on their website.To talk about information in the singular, do not say 'an information', say a piece/bit of information.✗ Sue has just told me a useful information.Sue has just told me a useful bit of information.




information, news, intelligence

这组词都有“新闻，消息，情报”的意思，其区别是：
information: 普通用词，泛指消息、情报。
news: 普通用词，指主要通过报纸、广播和电视等报道的事件，强调消息的新闻性。
intelligence: 特指政治、经济、文化或军事等方面的秘密情报或消息。



message, information, data

这组词都有“资料、信息”的意思，其区别是：
message: 指通过书写、谈话和信号等方式所进行的通讯“信息”。
information: 和data作“资料”解时，前者仅指所获得、提供或描述的慨况，而不指具体的数据或资料，后者则指具体的资料。
data: 是datum的复数形式，本义指作为计算和测量基础的资料。


n. [计]  [通信] 信息，资料；知识； [图情] 情报；通知
 - feedback, advice, notice, knowledge of, cognition
examples: 英 [ˌɪnfə'meɪʃn] 美 [ˌɪnfər'meɪʃn]
n.信息；情报；资料；通知

(1) They were unable to provide much information.(2) We are able to get the information we need from the Internet.(3) The police haven't got enough information to catch the criminal.(4) He gave us a very interesting piece of information.
(1) 他们不能提供很多信息。(2) 我们可以从网上得到我们需要的信息。(3) 警方还未得到可捉拿这个罪犯的足够情报。(4) 他给我们一份很有趣的资料。
[sound:youdao-38ba8fd3-f1b6fbd1-464999dc-c7251cdc-88fb1c89.mp3]

translation:
vt. 居住; 在…出现; 填满
vi. 居住

时态：inhabited, inhabiting, inhabits
分布：栖息(61%)，居住于(23%)，占据(16%)


→in-,进入，使，-habit,持有，握住，词源同habitable,habitat.引申词义居住，栖息。
居住(in里面+habit→住里面→居住)[habit=dwell,表示"居住"]
vt.居住于,存在于;栖息于They inhabit the tropical forests.他们居住在热带森林中.
【参】inhabitant（n 居民；居住者）



verb transitive often passive ■to live in a place 居住于
•These remote islands are inhabited only by birds.这些偏僻的岛屿上只有鸟类栖息。





dwell, inhabit, reside, settle, lodge, live

这组词都有“居住、定居”的意思，其区别是：
dwell: 文学上的用词，口语中通常用live代替。
inhabit: 强调人或动物居住在某个地区并已适应某种特殊环境。
reside: 书面用词，指合法的永久性居住，也指在豪华的住宅里居住。
settle: 侧重指某人定居于城市、国家或地区，而不指居住的住所。
lodge: 指短时间或临时住宿。
live: 最普通用词，指固定的居住，可以是长期的，也可以是临时的。


vt. 栖息；居住于；占据
 - people, occupy, bag
vi. （古）居住；栖息
 - belong, room, harbor, live, dwell
examples: 英 [ɪn'hæbɪt] 美 [ɪn'hæbɪt]
v.居住于；占据；栖息

(1) Broadly, we investigate the world's lakes and rivers and the creatures which inhabit them.(2) Wookiees inhabit the upper levels of the forest, having built their massive cities within the interwoven canopy.(3) Under Forman's tutelage, actors fully inhabit their roles, the hospital becomes an evil institution, and the movie poignantly celebrates the human spirit.(4) Woodpeckers inhabit hollow trees.
(1) 宽广地，我们调查世界的湖和河和居住于他们的人。(2) 伍基人占据了树林的上层，并在交织的树冠上建造了巨大的城市。(3) 根据福尔曼的指导，演员完全占据自己的角色，医院成为一个邪恶的机构，和电影尖锐地庆祝人类的精神。(4) 啄木鸟栖息在中空的树中。
[sound:youdao-1d5ee80e-0a371c26-d4e07f7c-8ee2e844-bd807ffe.mp3]

translation:
n. 居民，住户; （栖息在某地区的）动物

分布：居民(100%)


→来自inhabit,居住，栖息。
住户,居民(inhabit+ant)[habit=dwell,表示"居住"]
居民(inhabit居住)[-ant 1.表形容词"…的"2.表名词"…人"3.表名词"…剂"]
n.居民,住户On the orbit, the rabbits habitually inherited the merits of the inhabitants.在轨道上,兔子习惯性地继承了居民们的优点.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a person or animal that lives in a particular place （某地的）居民，栖息动物
•a city of 5 million inhabitants拥有500万居民的城市





citizen, native, civilian, resident, inhabitant

这组词都有“居民，公民”的意思，其区别是：
citizen: 指拥有某国国籍或有某地区合法身份的人，即公民。
native: 指土生土长的本地居民。
civilian: 指相对于军人或官员的平民百姓。
resident: 多指长期居住或暂时居住的民民，有时也指旅居者。
inhabitant: 最普通用词，一般指常住居民。



individual, native, people, inhabitant

individual: 个人，有某种特点的人
native: 本地人，出生于某国（或某地）的人
people: 民族，种族，部落
inhabitant: （某地的）居民


n. 居民；居住者
 - liver, resident, dweller, habitant
examples: 英 [ɪn'hæbɪtənt] 美 [ɪn'hæbɪtənt]
n.居民
(1) Every inhabitant here has an obligation to pay taxes.(2) The inhabitant can see the Church House and the Death House， but never the exterior of the Court House.
(1) 这里的每一位居民都有纳税的义务。(2) 居民也能看到教会安置和死囚刑前的住房，但从未见过法院的外貌。

translation:
vt. & vi. 继承
vt. 经遗传获得（品质、身体特征等），继任

时态：inherited, inheriting, inherits
分布：继承(93%)，遗传(7%)


→in-,进入，使，-her,继承，词源同heir,heredity.即使继承，引申词义遗传。
vt.继承(金钱等),经遗传而得(性格,特征)On the orbit, the rabbits habitually inherited the merits of the inhabitants.在轨道上,兔子习惯性地继承了居民们的优点.



verb FROM DEAD PERSON  继承   ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive ■to receive money, a house, etc. from someone after they have died 继承
•Who will inherit the house when he dies?他死后由谁继承房子？

•All her children will inherit equally.她所有的子女将平分遗产。

[ɪn'her.ɪt] verb QUALITY  品质  transitive ■to be born with the same physical or mental characteristics as one of your parents or grandparents 经遗传而得
•Rosie inherited her red hair from her mother.罗茜那头红发遗传自她母亲。

[ɪn'her.ɪt] verb PROBLEM  问题  transitive ■to begin to have responsibility for a problem or situation that previously existed or belonged to another person 接手，承担（遗留的问题等）
•When I took on the job of manager, I inherited certain financial problems.我担任经理时接手了一些遗留的财务问题。




vt. 继承；遗传而得
 - succeed to, take sth over
examples: 英 [ɪn'herɪt] 美 [ɪn'herɪt]
v.继承；遗传
(1) The eldest son will inherit the title.(2) She inherited a house from her father.(3) The two children both inherit left-handedness from their parents.
(1) 长子将继承爵位。(2) 她从她父亲那儿继承了一所房子。(3) 这两个孩子都从父母身上遗传了左撇子。

translation:
adj. 最初的; 开始的; 首字母的
n. 首字母; [语音学]声母; 特大的大写字母
vt. 用姓名的首字母签名

时态：initialled, initialling, initials
分布：最初的(79%)，开始的(15%)，签姓名的首字母于(4%)，字首的(2%)


→in-,进入，使，-it,走，开始，词源同itinerary,exit.即走起来的，开始的。
开始的,最初的(in进入+it+ial→走进→开始的)[it=go,表示"行走"]
a.最初的,开头的;词首的n.词首大写字母The initial talks were the base of the later agreement.最初的会谈是后来达成协议的基础.



adjective [before noun]  IMPROVER  ■of or at the beginning 开始的，最初的
•My initial surprise was soon replaced by delight.我最初的惊讶很快变成了兴奋。

•Initial reports say that seven people have died, though this has not yet been confirmed.最初的报道说有七人丧生，但这个消息还未得到证实。

[ɪ'nɪʃ.əl] noun countable usually plural  ADVANCED  ■the first letter of a name, especially when used to represent a name （姓名的）首字母
•He wrote his initials, P.M.R., at the bottom of the page.他在页尾写上了他名字的首字母P.M.R.。

•Paul M. Reynolds refused to say what the initial "M" stood for.保罗‧M‧雷诺兹拒绝说出首字母M代表甚么意思。

•They carved their initials into a tree.他们把自己名字的首字母刻在树上。

[ɪ'nɪʃ.əl] verb transitive (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-)■to write your initials on something 在…上签署姓名的首字母
•I initialled the documents and returned them to personnel.我在档上签了自己名字的首字母，然后交还给人事部。





initial, original, primitive

initial: a.开始的，最初的，强调处于事物的起始阶段，也可以指位于开头地方的。
 • My initial good opinion of him changed with time.   时间长了我对他最初的好印象改变了。
original: a.最初的，最早的；原版的，原物的。指按顺序是首位的，在此前不再有更为原始的同类的东西；也指原件的，原物的，非仿造的东西。
 • This is the original piano on which the composer created some of his greatest works.   就是在这架钢琴上，这位作曲家创作出了他的一些伟大的作品。
primitive: a.原始的，上古的，早期的，指处于人类生命或事物发展的早期阶段，也可以指自然的或简朴的。
 • Primitive tribes live in the Amazon River basin.   原始部落居住在亚马逊河盆地。


adj. [数] 最初的；字首的
 - premier, original
examples: 英 [ɪ'nɪʃl] 美 [ɪ'nɪʃl]
n.(词)首字母adj.开始的；最初的；字首的vt.签姓名的首字母于

(1) This is a letter paper personalized with his initials.(2) After the initial cheers,the noise of the crowd began to die away as the group started playing.(3) We are through the initial testing period.(4) The word “hour” is pronounced without an initial aspirate.(5) She initialed a handkerchief and gave it to that young man.
(1) 这是一张有他姓名首字母的信纸。(2) 开始的欢呼声结束以后，乐队开始演奏，人们的喧闹声也随之逐渐消失。(3) 我们通过了最初的考试阶段(4) hour一词的首字母h不发送气音。(5) 她在手帕上绣上姓名的首字母，把它送给了那个年轻人。
[sound:youdao-7edad371-e423bc30-8bc8b9a0-a0489f56-51386b77.mp3]

translation:
n. 注射; 注射剂; [医]充血; （卫星等的）入轨

分布：注射(99%)，注射物(1%)


【记】inject（vt 注射；注入）；in里面，ject扔－扔到里面－注射



noun countable or uncountable DRUG  药物   ADVANCED  ■when someone puts a liquid, especially a drug, into a person's body using a needle and a syringe (= small tube) 注射
•Daily insulin injections are necessary for some diabetics.有些糖尿病患者必须每日注射胰岛素。

•This steroid is sometimes given by injection.这种类固醇有时透过注射注入体内。

[ɪn'dʒek.ʃən] noun countable or uncountable SOMETHING NEW  新东西  ■the introduction of something new that is necessary or helpful to a situation or process 投入；增添；引入，带来
•A cash injection of £20 million will be used to improve the health service.2000万英镑将被投入用于改善医疗服务。

•an injection of humour/excitement增添幽默／刺激




n. 注射；注射剂；充血；射入轨道
 - congestion, inoculability
examples: 英 [ɪn'dʒekʃn] 美 [ɪn'dʒekʃn]
n.注射；注射物；数学函数
(1) The morphine was administered by injection.(2) The doctor gave her an injection to alleviate the pain.
(1) 那吗啡是注射进去的。(2) 医生给她注射以减轻疼痛。

translation:
vt. 损害，毁坏; 伤害（名誉、自尊等）; （尤指事故中）伤害; 伤害（感情，自尊心等）

时态：injured, injuring, injures
分布：伤害(53%)，损害(27%)，损伤(20%)


→in-,不，非，-jur,法律，公正，词源同jury,justice.即审判不公，引申词义伤害。
v.损害,损伤,伤害I assure the injured jury that a sure insurance is ensured.我让受伤的陪审团确信一笔有把握的保险得到的确保.



US [-dʒɚ] verb transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to hurt or cause physical harm to a person or animal 伤害，损害
•A bomb exploded at the embassy, injuring several people.一枚炸弹在大使馆爆炸，造成数人受伤。

•She fell and injured her shoulder.她摔伤了肩膀。

•He was badly injured in the crash.他在车祸中受重伤。

•He claimed that working too hard was injuring his health.他声称工作过度损害了他的健康。





harm, hurt, damage, disable, injure, wound

这组词都有“损害，伤害”的意思，其区别是：
harm: 主要用于有生命的东西，语气略强于injure，指引起严重的痛苦和损伤；有时也用于抽象事物，指造成任何不良后果。
hurt: 普通用词，较口语化，侧重指给有生命的东西造成机体上或精神、感情上的或轻或重的伤害。
damage: 通常指对无生命物体的损害，并有降低其价值，破坏其功能等的后果。
disable: 强调使伤残。
injure: 较hurt正式，多用于有生命的事物。既可指伤害别人的事物。即可指伤害别人的健康、外貌、自尊心、名誉等，又可指使别人受伤或东西受损，同时含有受伤害部分至少暂时丧失功能的意味。
wound: 专指对身体的重伤，尤指在战斗中受的伤，强调外部创伤；也可指精神方面的伤害。


vt. 伤害，损害
 - hurt, knife
examples: 英 ['ɪndʒə(r)] 美 ['ɪndʒər]
vt.伤害；损害；损伤

(1) Don't injure yourself with that tool.(2) He that spare the bad injure the good.(3) It would naturally injure him in her estimation.(4) This rough life threatened to injure his health,but he didn't mind.(5) She was injured badly in the accident.(6) He injured his left hand in a fire.
(1) 不要让那工具伤害到你。(2) 饶恕了恶人，伤害了好人。(3) 那自然也会损害到她对他的评价。(4) 这种艰苦生活看来要损害他的健康，但他并不介意。(5) 她在这次意外中受到重伤。(6) 他在火灾中伤了左手。
[sound:youdao-e99e53ce-93e3037e-cab4573f-9c560c02-4b831e25.mp3]

translation:
n. 伤害，损害; 受伤处; 伤害的行为

分布：伤害(77%)，损害(23%)


→来自injure,伤害。
伤害;不法行为(in不+jury法→不法行为)[jur,juris=swear,law,表示"发誓,法律"]
n.伤害,损害My durable endurance made me endure the injury during insurance.我持久的忍耐力使我忍受了保险期间的伤害.



US [-dʒɚ-] noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■physical harm or damage to someone's body caused by an accident or an attack 伤害，损伤
•a head/back/knee injury头部／背部／膝盖受伤

•Several train passengers received/sustained serious injuries in the crash.在这次撞车事故中火车上几名乘客受重伤。

•Injuries to the spine are common amongst these workers.脊椎受伤在这些工人中是很普遍的。

•They were lucky to escape (without) injury.他们很幸运，没有受伤。

UK ['ɪn.dʒər.i] US [-dʒɚ-] noun countable or uncountable do yourself an injury UK informal ■to hurt yourself 使（自己）受伤
•Don't even think about lifting me up, Ted, you might do yourself an injury.特德，千万别想把我举起来，你会弄伤自己的！




n. [植保] 伤害，损害；受伤处
 - harm, damage
examples: 英 ['ɪndʒəri] 美 ['ɪndʒəri]
n.伤害；损害

(1) She still suffers considerable discomfort from her injury.(2) He had a spinal injury in that accident.(3) The injury to their key player could be a decisive factor in the game.(4) Motorcyclists must wear helmets to shield them from injury.(5) It's a severe injury to my reputation.

translation:
n. 墨水，油墨; （乌贼分泌的）墨液

时态：inked, inking, inks
分布：墨水(92%)，墨汁(8%)


→来自拉丁语encaustum,红色或粉色熔蜡，来自en-,进入，使，-caust,烧，词源同caustic,holocaust.原指古罗马时期用烧熔化的红色蜡水来签署文件或用熔蜡来封印重要的官方文件。后词义通用化指墨水。
n.墨水,油墨While sinking into thinking, the shrinking linkman drank the pink ink sprinkled on the wrinkly paper.陷入沉思时,退缩的联络员喝掉了洒在皱纹纸上的粉红色墨水.



noun countable or uncountable  ADVANCED  ■coloured liquid used for writing, printing and drawing 墨水；油墨；墨汁
•a bottle of ink一瓶墨水

•blue/black/red ink蓝／黑／红墨水

•Please write in ink, not in pencil.书写请用墨水笔，不要用铅笔。

•The book is printed in three different coloured inks.这本书是用三色油墨印刷的。

[ɪŋk] noun countable or uncountable the ink is not dry/still wet ■You say that the ink is not dry/still wet on a document if it has just been written or produced （档）刚写成的或制作完成的
•The ink was barely dry on the peace agreement when fighting broke out again.和平协议才刚签好，战斗又再爆发了。

[ɪŋk] verb transitive specialized  ADVANCED  ■to put ink on something 给…上油墨
•The printing plates have to be inked before they will print on the paper.在印刷之前必须给印版上油墨。

 - atrament
examples: 英 [ɪŋk] 美 [ɪŋk]
n.墨水；墨汁

(1) There's an ink stain on your shirt.(2) He has run out of red ink.(3) He swore at the boy who dropped ink on the book.(4) If the ink sinks in it'll be hard to remove it.(5) These ink stains won't wash out.(6) Thick black ink like that doesn't usually wash out.(7) The boy tried to paint a picture in Indian ink.
(1) 你的衬衫上有一个墨水斑。(2) 他的红墨水用完了。(3) 他对那把墨水倒翻在书上的孩子臭骂了一顿。(4) 如果墨水渗入，要除去就很困难。(5) 这些墨迹洗不掉。(6) 那么浓黑的墨汁一般是洗不掉的。(7) 那个男孩尝试着用墨汁作一幅画。

translation:
adj. 内部的，内心的; 精神的; 秘密的
n. 内部，里面; 射中接近靶心部分的一发

分布：内心的(54%)，内部的(19%)，里面(14%)，里面的(13%)


→来自in的比较级。
a.内部的,里面的;内心的We are dined and wined in the inner dining-room of the inn.在旅店的内部餐厅,我们受到了酒宴款待.



US [-ɚ] adjective [before noun]  IMPROVER  ■inside or contained within something else 里面的
•Leading off the main hall is a series of small inner rooms.从主客厅开始是一系列小的内室。

•humorous Few people ever managed to penetrate the director's inner sanctum (= very private room).很少人进过经理的私人密室。
 IMPROVER  ■Inner feelings or thoughts are ones that you do not show or tell other people 内心的
•Sarah seemed to have a profound sense of inner peace.萨拉内心好像非常平静。





interior, inward, inner, inside, internal

这组词都有“内部的，内在的”的意思，其区别是：
interior: 指某物的内部，尤指某物的内侧；也可指内地的或国内的。
inward: 指朝着中心或内部方向的，侧重方向而不是位置；也可指内心的隐密活动。
inner: 含义广泛，指事物中心或接近中心的部位，也可指内心隐密的活动。
inside: 多指处于某物内部或靠近内部，常可与inner换用，可引申指内幕的，秘密的。
internal: 书面用词，医学上多用，指事物的内部，也可指国内的或内政的。


adj. 内部的；内心的；精神的
 - internal, mental, inside, spiritual
n. 内部
 - interior, inside
examples: 英 ['ɪnə(r)] 美 ['ɪnər]
adj.内心的；内部的；里面的n.里面

(1) He has no inner resources and hates being alone.(2) Her artificial gaiety disguised an inner sadness.(3) I no longer felt the inner restraint.(4) Does it ever occur to you to use your sight to see into the inner nature of a friend or acquaintance?(5) Outsiders are not privy to the party's inner workings.(6) Cochlea is spiral-shaped part of the inner ear.(7) She went into the inner room to change her dress.(8) Time is therefore always ticking in our inner ear.(9) It is because they have identical inner quality.
(1) 他没有内在的精神寄托，因而害怕孤独。(2) 她以矫揉造作的快乐掩饰著内心的悲痛。(3) 我再也不感到内心的压抑了。(4) 你曾否想到用你的视觉去探视一位朋友或认识的人的内在本性？(5) 外人无法得知该党的内部运作。(6) 耳蜗是内耳里螺旋状的部分。(7) 她走进内室去换衣服。(8) 因此时间总是在我们内耳里面滴滴答答地走。(9) 因为它们里面品质是这样。
[sound:youdao-7ebf1895-b5b9bee5-c627bf4b-baf130fe-dcdf4d07.mp3]

translation:
adj. 无辜的，无罪的; 清白的; 天真无邪的; 无知的
n. 无辜者; 头脑简单的人; 天真无邪的人

分布：无辜的(68%)，清白的(20%)，无害的(6%)，无知的(5%)，天真纯洁的(1%)


→in-,不，非，-noc,伤害，词源同noxious,nuisance.即没有伤害的，引申词义无辜的，天真的。
无害的;天真的(in无+noc+ent→无害的)[noc,nox=hurt,poison,表示"伤害,毒"]
a.(of)清白的,无罪的;无害的;单纯的,无知的Those innocent adolescents ascending the hill are the tribe's descendants of decent descent.这些爬山的天真青少年是这个部落具有正派血统的后代.



adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■(of a person) not guilty of a particular crime, or having no knowledge of the unpleasant and evil things in life, or (of a thing) not intended to harm anyone （人）无罪的，天真的，无辜的；（事物）无恶意的
•He firmly believes that she is innocent of the crime.他坚信她是清白的。

•She has such an innocent face that I find it hard to believe anything bad of her.她一脸天真无邪，我很难把她往坏的方面想。

•It was an innocent remark, I didn't mean to hurt his feelings.那句话没有恶意，我并不想伤害他的感情。
 Compare guilty  ADVANCED  ■An innocent person is someone who is not involved with any military group or war 无辜（受害）的
•Several innocent bystanders were injured in the explosion.几个无辜的旁观者在爆炸中受了伤。

['ɪn.ə.sənt] noun countable ■a person who has very little experience and does not know about the bad things that happen in life 幼稚的人；不谙世事者



adj. [法] 无辜的；无罪的；无知的
 - dark, empty, clear
n. 天真的人；笨蛋
 - simple, turkey, put
examples: 英 ['ɪnəsnt] 美 ['ɪnəsnt]
adj.清白的；无害的；无辜的；无知的；天真纯洁的

(1) A man is accounted innocent until he is proven guilty.(2) He was charged with murder but found innocent later.(3) It was an innocent deception, meant as a joke.(4) He declared that he was innocent.(5) Don't be so innocent as to believe everything the politicians tell you.
(1) 一个人未被证明有罪前，被视为是清白的。(2) 他被控杀人，但后来发现他是无罪的。(3) 那是个无伤大雅的骗术，开个玩笑而已。(4) 他声称自己是无罪的。(5) 别那么幼稚,以为政客说的一切都是可信的。

translation:
n. 输入，投入; 输入电路; <电>输入端; 输入的数据
vt. 把…输入电脑; [自][电子] 输入; 输入，给料

时态：input, inputting, inputs
分布：输入(88%)，投入(6%)，输入数据(3%)，输入信息(2%)，信息输入端(1%)


→in-,进入，使，put,放置。
n./v.输入One, or a sequence of, input states.一个或一序列的输入状态.



noun countable or uncountable ■something such as energy, money or information that is put into a system, organization or machine so that it can operate （能源、资金或资讯的）投入，输入
•I didn't have much input into the project (= The help I gave or work I did on it was small).该专案计划我参与不多。

•The power input will come largely from hydroelectricity.电力输入主要来自水力发电。
countable specialized ■the part that carries information to a machine, or the place where this is connected 讯息输入端
•The inputs for the CD-ROM are at the back of the computer.光碟唯读记忆体的输入端在电脑的背后。

•an input device输入装置

['ɪn.pʊt] verb transitive (inputting, inputted or input, inputted or input)■to put information into a computer or other piece of electronic equipment （将资讯）输入；录入（电脑或其他电子设备）
•I've spent the morning inputting data into the computer.我花了一个上午将资料输入电脑。




n. 投入；输入电路

n.投入；输入信息；输入数据；信息输入端v.输入

(1) I'd appreciate your input on this.(2) The state has further increased its input in the family planning undertaking.(3) There are several errors in the input.(4) Two input keys don't work.(5) The most popular input device is the terminal.(6) I have inputted the data into a computer.(7) We use a keyboard to input the data.
(1) 我将感激你在这方面的投入。(2) 国家进一步加大了对计划生育事业的投入。(3) 输入中有好几处错误。(4) 有两个输入键有毛病。(5) 最通用的输入设备是终端器。(6) 我已经把数据输入到计算机中了。(7) 我们用键盘把数据输入电脑。

translation:
vt. & vi. 打听，询问; 查究

时态：inquired, inquiring, inquires
分布：询问(88%)，查究(12%)

enquire 询问;调查;打听
盘问,追究(in进入+quire→问进去→盘问)[Quest,quir,quis,quer=seek,search,表示"寻求,询问"]



US [-'kwaɪr] verb intransitive or transitive  ADVANCED  ■to ask for information 询问，打听
•Shall I inquire about the price of tickets?我可以问一下票价吗？
•[+ question word] She rang up to inquire when her car would be ready.她打电话询问她的车何时能准备好。
•[+ speech] "Where are we going?" he inquired politely.“我们要去哪里？”他客气地问道。

(UK also enquire) UK [ɪn'kwaɪər] US [-'kwaɪr] verb intransitive or transitive inquire within mainly UK ■written on a notice on a building, meaning that information can be found inside （写在建筑物的告示上）详情请入内查询
•Saturday staff needed - Inquire within.招聘周六工作人员——详情请入内查询。

(UK also enquire) UK [ɪn'kwaɪər] US [-'kwaɪr] verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   inquire after sb mainly UK (ALSO UK also enquire after sb) ■to ask for information about someone, especially about their health, in order to be polite 问候，询问（尤指健康状况）
•She inquired after his grandfather's health.她询问了他祖父的健康状况。

(UK also enquire) UK [ɪn'kwaɪər] US [-'kwaɪr] verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   inquire into sth formal (ALSO UK also enquire into sth) ■to try to discover the facts about something 调查，查究；查问
•When the authorities inquired into his background, they found he had a criminal record.当局调查他的背景时，发现他有犯罪前科。




inquire, acquire, achieve, require

inquire: 打听，询问。如：inquire a person’s name(问一个人的姓名)
acquire: 取得，获得，学到。如：acquire knowledge (获得知识)
achieve: (成功地)完成，实现。如：He will never achieve anything unless he works harder. (如他不努力工作，将会一事无成。)
require: 需要。如：We require more help. (我们需要更多的帮助。)



inquire, question, ask, demand

这组词都有“问，询问”的意思，其区别是：
inquire: 较正式用词，指为得到真实情况而详细询问或调查了解。
question: 指因感到可疑或为了解情况，弄清究竟而发问，有时指一连串的发问。
ask: 最普通用词，可与demand, inquire和question换用，但ask用于口语中，指提出问题让人回答。
demand: 指根据自己的权利、职责或身份认为有必要弄清情况而正式发问，常隐含命令对方回答的意味。


vt. 询问；查究；问明
 - question, query
vi. 询问；查究；询价
 - question, query
examples: 英 [ɪn'kwaɪə(r)] 美 [ɪn'kwaɪər]
vt.询问；查究vi.询问；查究

(1) I shall inquire of him why the train is late.(2) He frowned and determined to inquire thoroughly into the matter.(3) I recommend that you inquire about the job.(4) He went to inquire for a letter at the post office.(5) The police will inquire into the cause of his death.
(1) 我要去问他火车为什么晚点。(2) 他把眉头一皱，决计要把事情查究个彻底。(3) 我建议你打听一下这项工作。(4) 他到邮局去查问一封信。(5) 警方将调查他的死因。
[sound:youdao-038abfb2-a0bcb6f7-de68608c-f1110b69-bda6265b.mp3]

translation:
n. 调查，审查; 询问，质问，质询，追究; 探究; 打听

分布：调查(67%)，询问(25%)，打听(6%)，查问(2%)


质询(inquire询问)[-y 1.加在名词后变成形容词2表名词,加在形容词或以r结尾的单词后3表名词"人或小东西"常带有戏谑性和爱称]
n.(enquiry)询问,打听,调查I made inquiries about it at the desk.我在柜台询问那件事.
【参】inquire（v 询问）；inquisition（n 调查；审理）【区】inquisitive（adj 好奇的；好问的）＝prying



US ['ɪŋ.kwɚ.i] noun QUESTION  问题   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■(the process of asking) a question 询问，打听
•I've been making inquiries about/into the cost of a round-the-world ticket.我一直在打听环游世界的票价。

•formal Inquiry into the matter is pointless - no one will tell you anything.打听这件事没有用——没有人会告诉你。

(UK also enquiry) UK [ɪn'kwaɪə.ri] US ['ɪŋ.kwɚ.i] noun PROCESS  过程   IMPROVER  countable ■an official process to discover the facts about something bad that has happened 调查，查究
•a judicial inquiry司法调查

•Citizens have demanded a full inquiry into the government's handling of the epidemic.公众要求全面调查政府对这场传染病的处理是否得当。





inquiry, investigation, research, survey

这些名词均有“调查”之意。
inquiry: 普通常用词，指正式调查，也指一般的打听或查询。
investigation: 一般指有系统的调查以得到希望发现或需要知道的事。
research: 指科学工作者等为揭示自然规律或获取某个领域的新知识而进行长时间的调查研究。
survey: 多指为写书面报告而进行的民意测验或调查。


n. 探究；调查；质询
 - investigation, exploration, probe, research, search
examples: 英 [ɪn'kwaɪərɪ] 美 [ɪn'kwaɪrɪ]
n.调查；询问；打听；查问=enquiry(英).

(1) We made an application to the court for an inquiry.(2) They've promised a thorough inquiry into the plane crash.(3) I'm not able to help you with your inquiry.(4) He is fishing for information by a letter of inquiry.(5) Please quote us as soon as you receive our inquiry.
(1) 我们曾请求法院调查。(2) 他们答应对这次飞机失事进行彻底的调查。(3) 我对你的咨询无能为力。(4) 他写信询问，希望打听一下消息。(5) 请接到我们的询价单后马上给我们报价。
[sound:youdao-c9b7173c-9db638e3-46abbbcf-accf2cdc-fdc5578c.mp3]

translation:
n. 虫，昆虫; 卑鄙的人; 微贱的人，小人
adj. 昆虫的; 卑劣的

分布：昆虫(91%)，虫子(8%)，卑微的人(1%)


→in-,进入，使，-sect,切，分，词源同sex,segment.因昆虫分段的躯体而得名。
昆虫(in进入+sect→昆虫一节一节如被切开一样)[Sect,seg=cut,divide,表示"切,割"]
n.昆虫This section about insects is written by a respectable specialist.关于昆虫的这一节是由一位可敬的专家撰写的.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a type of very small animal with six legs, a body divided into three parts and usually two pairs of wings, or, more generally, any similar very small animal 昆虫
•Ants, beetles, butterflies and flies are all insects.蚂蚁、甲虫、蝴蝶和苍蝇都是昆虫。

•I've got some sort of insect bite on my leg.我腿上被小虫咬了一口。





worm, pest, bug, insect

这组词都有“虫，昆虫”的意思，其区别是：
worm: 侧重指蚯蚓、蚕、毛虫等小而无骨的虫。
pest: 指有害的昆虫或有害的小动物。
bug: 指小昆虫，尤指吸血的臭虫，也可指细菌。
insect: 含义广泛，多指蚂蚁、黄蜂、蝉等等。


n. [昆] 昆虫；卑鄙的人
 - ratfink, warb
examples: 英 ['ɪnsekt] 美 ['ɪnsekt]
n.昆虫；虫子；卑微的人

(1) The insect bit him and drew blood from his arm.(2) A cocoon is a kind of silk covering made by an insect.(3) She stamped on the insect and killed it.(4) A locust is a kind of destructive insect.(5) He is just an insect in the company and deserves no mention.
(1) 那只昆虫叮在他的手臂上吸血。(2) 蚕茧是由昆虫制造的一种由丝组成的外包层。(3) 她踩死了一只虫子。(4) 蝗虫是一种害虫。(5) 他只是个无足轻重的人，不值一提。

translation:
vt. 插入; 嵌入; （在文章中）添加; 加插
n. 添入物（尤指一页印刷品图中插入或套印的小图）; （书报的）插页; 插入物; 添加物

US [-ˈsɜ˞ːt/■to put something inside something else, or to add something, especially words, to something else 插入，添加（尤指文字）
